title: Korean Ground Beef Bowls
ingredients: ¼ cup reduced sodium soy sauce
directions: Heat a pan over medium high heat. Add the Asian vegetables and water. Cover and cook for 3-4 minutes until tender crisp. Be careful not to overcook the vegetables. If they begin to burn or stick, add additional water. When done, remove and set aside. /p Add the ground beef to the pan. Cook, breaking it up, until cooked through. /p Mix together soy sauce, brown sugar, sesame oil, chili paste, garlic, and ginger. Add to the ground beef and bring to a simmer. Cook 3-4 minutes. /p Stir in vegetables or serve on side, scooping sauce on top. Serve in lettuce wraps, as a beef bowl, or over rice.  /p Serving size: ¼ of total yield  /p Calories: 296/serving (496/serving with 1 cup of cooked rice)
